title: ICE: no MIR available for DefId when compiling `--crate-type lib` with rmeta dependency

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust $ cat foo.rs pub fn foo() {} $ cat bar.rs pub fn bar() { foo::foo(); } $ rustc --crate-type lib --emit metadata foo.rs $ rustc --extern foo=libfoo.rmeta --crate-type lib bar.rs error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_monomorphize/src/collector.rs:1012:9: no MIR available for DefId(20:3 ~ foo[bcc9]::foo) ``` ### Meta Reproduces on both stable and nightly as of 4/6/23: `rustc +nightly --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (cf7ada217 2023-04-03) binary: rustc commit-hash: cf7ada217c8ac63367b184afd9fffaff30f6ed44 commit-date: 2023-04-03 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.0 ``` `rustc +stable --version --verbose`: ``` $ rustc +stable --version --verbose rustc 1.68.2 (9eb3afe9e 2023-03-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9eb3afe9ebe9c7d2b84b71002d44f4a0edac95e0 commit-date: 2023-03-27 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.68.2 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ```
Backtrace
